description: Firebase and LZ locations in/near A Shau Valley, compiled from DOD records

features.name: Hill 937 (Hamburger Hill / Dong Ap Bia)
features.notes: 10-day assault by 101st Airborne, 3/187th Infantry. 72 KIA, 372 WIA.

features.name: Firebase Ripcord
features.notes: Last major US firebase battle. 101st Airborne. Evacuated under fire.

features.name: Firebase Bastogne
features.notes: 101st Airborne base, east of A Shau Valley. Multiple attacks.

features.name: Firebase Blaze
features.notes: Eastern ridge of A Shau Valley.

features.name: A Luoi Airfield
features.notes: Valley floor airstrip. Captured by NVA March 1966. US recaptured during Operation Delaware April 1968.

features.name: A Shau Special Forces Camp
features.notes: CIDG/Special Forces camp. Overrun by NVA March 9-10, 1966. Battle of A Shau.

features.name: Ta Bat Airfield
features.notes: Northern valley floor airstrip near Laos border.

features.name: LZ Stallion
features.notes: Helicopter landing zone on valley floor.

features.name: LZ Pepper
features.notes: Landing zone east of valley center.

features.name: LZ Goodman
features.notes: Staging area for Hamburger Hill assault.

features.name: Tiger Mountain (Dong Ngai)
features.notes: Western ridge, Laos border. NVA observation and anti-aircraft positions.

features.name: Dong So Ridge
features.notes: Eastern ridgeline overlooking valley. Multiple firebase sites.

features.name: Route 548 (Valley Road)
features.notes: Main road through A Shau Valley floor, NW-SE. Part of Ho Chi Minh Trail network. All-weather road by 1968.

features.name: NVA Base Area 611
features.notes: Major NVA logistics base on Laos border side of western ridge. Supply depot for A Shau corridor.
